communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Custodian of Records,

Under the Alaska Open Records Law, A.S. Code § 40-25-110 et seq., I am requesting:

1. Aggregate data on the number of deaths occurring in your agency’s custody from the year 2019 to the date this request is processed
2. All de-identified records concerning individuals who died while in your agency’s custody during 2019 until the date this request is processed. I request records that indicate information about these individuals’ incarceration (specifically their custody status—ie whether pre-trial, post adjudication, or immigration detainer as appropriate—the date of their incarceration, and demographic information including race, ethnicity, age, gender), and records that contain information about their death (at the very least the date of death and the cause of death in as much detail as possible).

The above request could be for original records, or as an extract of your database(s) with line level data by individual who died including the following fields:
A. Facility
B. Date of death
C. Date of incarceration
D. Cause of death (as much detail as possible) – but at least categories such as illness, suicide, homicide, drug overdose, etc.
E. Age
F. Race
G. Gender
H. Custody Status – i.e. whether pre-trial, post adjudication

Concerning the request for extracts of your database, per Attorney Gen. v. Dist. Attorney for Plymouth Dist., 484 Mass. 260, 141 N.E.3d 429 (2020), compiling information from a database is not tantamount to creating a new record that would otherwise be precluded under public records law. Specifically: “Where public records are in electronic form, a public records request that requires a government entity to search its electronic database to extract requested data does not mean that the extracted data constitute the creation of a new record, which would not be required, under the public records law. " Id. at 442 to 443

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $10. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the state of Alaska’s treatment of its incarcerated citizens.

The release of the information is for non-commercial purposes. I am a researcher for Business Insider, a news organization based in New York City, whose mission is journalism in the public interest. This request is for news gathering purposes. I, or my colleagues at Business Insider or Insider, will use the records to inform the public through our reporting. I therefore request a waiver of all fees and charges pursuant to Alaska Open Records Law.

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available.

If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of Alaska Open Records Law. If you claim such an exemption to my request under Alaska Open Records Law, please cite in writing the specific statutory exemption. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees.

Please produce these records in the electronic format (such as excel file (.xlsx) or other database form, or as .pdfs) and share them with me via email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible.

Please respond to this request in a reasonable time period. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Beckler

title: Martin Lloyd Blank employment info (Saginaw County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

— All personnel records releasable under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, including, but not limited to, job description; resume; salary and contract details; start and termination dates; certifications, complaints and enforcement actions and any other similar personnel records related to Martin Lloyd Blank

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Derek Kravitz

title: SUNRISE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - Redmond, WA.  – (2024) Investigations of MULTIPLE Northshore Elementary School Principals using COCAINE and/or possessing HANDGUNS or FIREARMS – MOORLANDS ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - Kenmore, WA. (Northshore School District)

communications.communication:
To whom it may Concern - PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56


AS RECENTLY REPORTED IN THE NEWS:

Michael Benjamin Griffin - Principal - Sunrise Elementary School - 14075 172nd Avenue NE Redmond, WA 98052 - 425-408-5300

Meghan Suzane Griffin - Principal - Moorlands Elementary School - 15115 84th Avenue NE Kenmore, WA 98028 - 425-408-5100

Northshore School Principals Gone Wild: A loaded gun, cocaine, and QFC

https://lynnwoodtimes.com/2023/06/02/cocaine-principals-230602/

Police confiscate 3 guns from Northshore Schools' principals believed to be on cocaine

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_kM90vqHuM

Northshore School District holds meeting to address principals GUNS and COCAINE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NtDI_xkqmic

Guns, drugs and principals: Issues continue for Northshore School District | FOX 13 Seattle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPXZOcwL6pg

Northshore principal allegedly high on drugs, with guns, district announces new staff

https://news.yahoo.com/footage-shows-police-confronting-northshore-013059725.html

Two Northshore elementary principals on leave after alleged cocaine use

https://mynorthwest.com/3896022/two-northshore-elementary-principals-on-leave-after-alleged-cocaine-use/

Administrators meet face-to-face after principals caught with COCAINE and GUNS

https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/administrators-meet-face-to-face-after-principals-alleged-drug-use-lands-them-on-leave

Sunrise Elementary School Principal Michael B. Griffin and Moorlands Elementary School Principal Megan S. Griffin – Cocaine and guns

https://komonews.com/news/local/2-northshore-school-district-principals-administrative-leave-alleged-cocaine-use-firearms-qfc-grocery-store-moorlands-elementary-sunrise-police-law-enforcement-campus-drugs-narcotics-officers-criminal-charges

Police find cocaine, loaded gun; two elementary principals placed on administrative leave

https://www.wftv.com/news/trending/cocaine-loaded-gun-lead-two-elementary-principals-being-placed-administrative-leave/6XT7SFY6TBB5HNZIOCKDHIG6MU/


PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56:

I request any/all public records of the following:

1.	COCAINE – Use of cocaine by Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers on or off elementary school grounds.
2.	FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Names of all Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers in possession of HANDGUNS or FIREARMS on elementary school grounds.
3.	KIDNAPPING – any records or police reports referencing KIDNAPPING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
4.	RESISTING ARREST - any records or police reports referencing RESISTING ARREST by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
5.	CARJACKING - any records or police reports referencing CARJACKING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
6.	DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - any records or police reports referencing DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
7.	HIT AND RUN - any records or police reports referencing HIT AND RUN by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
8.	OBSTRUCTION - any records or police reports referencing OBSTRUCTION by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
9.	CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - copies of all CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES of any current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
10.	GUILTY PLEAS – copies of all STATEMENT OF DEFENDANT ON PLEA OF GUILTY entered into by any former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
11.	COMPLAINTS - any records referencing COMPLAINTS by the POLICE or the GENERAL PUBLIC about current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.

NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT ELEMENTARY MAP
https://resources.finalsite.net/images/f_auto,q_auto,t_image_size_6/v1593008632/nsdorg/vfshznfaamnxgxqv0o1t/elementary-boundary-map.jpg

title: SUNRISE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - Redmond, WA.  – (2024) Investigations of MULTIPLE Northshore Elementary School Principals using COCAINE and/or possessing HANDGUNS or FIREARMS – MOORLANDS ELEMENTARY SCHOOL - Kenmore, WA. (King County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To whom it may Concern - PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56


AS RECENTLY REPORTED IN THE NEWS:

Michael Benjamin Griffin - Principal - Sunrise Elementary School - 14075 172nd Avenue NE Redmond, WA 98052 - 425-408-5300

Meghan Suzane Griffin - Principal - Moorlands Elementary School - 15115 84th Avenue NE Kenmore, WA 98028 - 425-408-5100

Northshore School Principals Gone Wild: A loaded gun, cocaine, and QFC

https://lynnwoodtimes.com/2023/06/02/cocaine-principals-230602/

Police confiscate 3 guns from Northshore Schools' principals believed to be on cocaine

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_kM90vqHuM

Northshore School District holds meeting to address principals GUNS and COCAINE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NtDI_xkqmic

Guns, drugs and principals: Issues continue for Northshore School District | FOX 13 Seattle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPXZOcwL6pg

Northshore principal allegedly high on drugs, with guns, district announces new staff

https://news.yahoo.com/footage-shows-police-confronting-northshore-013059725.html

Two Northshore elementary principals on leave after alleged cocaine use

https://mynorthwest.com/3896022/two-northshore-elementary-principals-on-leave-after-alleged-cocaine-use/

Administrators meet face-to-face after principals caught with COCAINE and GUNS

https://www.fox13seattle.com/news/administrators-meet-face-to-face-after-principals-alleged-drug-use-lands-them-on-leave

Sunrise Elementary School Principal Michael B. Griffin and Moorlands Elementary School Principal Megan S. Griffin – Cocaine and guns

https://komonews.com/news/local/2-northshore-school-district-principals-administrative-leave-alleged-cocaine-use-firearms-qfc-grocery-store-moorlands-elementary-sunrise-police-law-enforcement-campus-drugs-narcotics-officers-criminal-charges

Police find cocaine, loaded gun; two elementary principals placed on administrative leave

https://www.wftv.com/news/trending/cocaine-loaded-gun-lead-two-elementary-principals-being-placed-administrative-leave/6XT7SFY6TBB5HNZIOCKDHIG6MU/


PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56:

I request any/all public records of the following:

1.	COCAINE – Use of cocaine by Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers on or off elementary school grounds.
2.	FIREARMS/HANDGUNS – Names of all Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers in possession of HANDGUNS or FIREARMS on elementary school grounds.
3.	KIDNAPPING – any records or police reports referencing KIDNAPPING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
4.	RESISTING ARREST - any records or police reports referencing RESISTING ARREST by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
5.	CARJACKING - any records or police reports referencing CARJACKING and current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
6.	DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL - any records or police reports referencing DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
7.	HIT AND RUN - any records or police reports referencing HIT AND RUN by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
8.	OBSTRUCTION - any records or police reports referencing OBSTRUCTION by current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
9.	CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES - copies of all CRIMINAL or CIVIL CHARGES of any current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
10.	GUILTY PLEAS – copies of all STATEMENT OF DEFENDANT ON PLEA OF GUILTY entered into by any former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.
11.	COMPLAINTS - any records referencing COMPLAINTS by the POLICE or the GENERAL PUBLIC about current or former Northshore School District Elementary School Principals or teachers.

NORTHSHORE SCHOOL DISTRICT ELEMENTARY MAP
https://resources.finalsite.net/images/f_auto,q_auto,t_image_size_6/v1593008632/nsdorg/vfshznfaamnxgxqv0o1t/elementary-boundary-map.jpg

title: New Jersey police personnel and pensions

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: New Jersey police personnel and pensions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- I request digital records, in spreadsheet format (.csv or .xlsx), of the number of police officers for cities/towns/counties in the state of New Jersey who are active employees enrolled in the pension system, from 2010 (or the first year available) to 2022. The first and second columns of the spreadsheet should indicate the year and city/town/county, respectively, and the third should report the number of active employees of the police force enrolled in the pension system. 

- Additionally, I request the number of police officers per city/town/county per year who retire from the police force, and the number of new hires by the police department who enter into the pension system, in the fourth and fifth columns, respectively.

If the above information exists only in part, I request that you share what you have rather than deny the request in full.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessie Trudeau
